channel.title: Unused '@ts-expect-error' directive
channel.description:
### src/visualizations/table/Renderer.tsx(130,9): error TS2578: Unused '@ts-expect-error' directive.
**A summary of the issue :slight_smile:** I am using this Redash guide https://redash.io/help/open-source/dev-guide/remote-server when i do *npm install* i get the error bellow :
![Redash_directive_error|690x437](upload://wsYCJW6iDRstZhMl4fHQC4ch75b.png)
Can someone help me or explain to me what is going on? Am I doing something wrong :no_mouth:?
### Technical details:
* Node Version: v15.10.0 * NPM Version: v7.5.3 * Browser/OS: i have wondows machine * How did you install Redash: clone github repo + npm install

item.title: Unused '@ts-expect-error' directive
item.dc:creator: thfox2014
item.description:
I delete redash-master/node_modules/@redash/viz/src/visualizations/table/Renderer.tsx line 125 “//@ts-expect-error’ XXXXXXXX” , it works

Read full topic

item.title: Unused '@ts-expect-error' directive
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
If you’re running the latest version of master you should use yarn and not npm.

Read full topic

item.title: Unused '@ts-expect-error' directive
item.dc:creator: ajgreen
item.description:
we have a similar following issue with when we build using npm run build:

  • error TS2578: Unused ‘@ts-expect-error’ directive.

Let me know if you were able to resolve the issue or someone did. Thanks
Technical details:

  • Node Version: v16.11.1
  • NPM Version: v8.0.0
  • Browser/OS: Deploying o Mac OS Big Sur
  • How did you install Redash: v10 code from github and followed the development guide (npm install, npm run build, npm run start)

Read full topic
